wikipedia_page.main:
Arthur Bezer (20 October 1875 – 11 July 1944) was an English cricketer. He was a left-arm bowler who played for Somerset. He was born and died in Bath.Bezer made his only first-class appearance during the 1914 season, playing against Hampshire. He scored a duck in the first innings and just one run in the second innings of a match which Somerset lost by a margin of an innings and 192 runs. Bezer bowled two overs during the match, conceding twelve runs.
He worked as the groundsman at Bath Cricket Club.
